Check the file path for typos and use absolute paths if the script moves.

Error: File too large: too many records or columns
ActionRecommended: Split the file into smaller chunks or increase the memory limit of the importing application.

Error: Map the remaining required fields to proceed
ActionRecommended: Review the list of mandatory attributes and ensure all necessary columns are correctly mapped in the CSV.
Ensure the last line of your CSV file ends with a linefeed (\n) or carriage return (\r\n) character.
Find and strip non-printing or POSIX non-compliant characters from your data using a text editor like [Notepad++](url).
Verify that the AWS CLI or user has the correct IAM permissions for the S3 bucket or object.
Check for unescaped special characters in the request string or CSV data and validate syntax.
Check if the temporary storage directory exists and has sufficient write permissions.

Error: The specified action can be called only once
ActionRecommended: Verify user permissions; some roles cannot be inherited through teams and must be assigned directly.
Fix the mapping in the data project or ensure the CSV file contains all expected columns defined in the schema.

Error: Literal does not match format string (ORA-01861)
ActionRecommended: Check that the date or number format in the CSV matches the expected format string in the database.

Error: CSV delimiter appearing in data column
ActionRecommended: Wrap data values containing commas in quotation marks or use a different delimiter like a pipe (|) or semicolon (;).
Save the file as UTF-8 encoding to ensure all special characters are supported and readable across systems.
Recreate the association between the external stage and the storage integration if the latter was recreated.

Error: CSV format error: Column count mismatch
ActionRecommended: Check for stray commas in your data and ensure every row has the same number of delimiters as the header.

Error: 404 Not Found: Resource does not exist
ActionRecommended: Verify the endpoint URL or object ID; check the [Google Cloud Status Dashboard](https://status.cloud.google.com) for service outages.
Ensure true/false columns contain only '1/0', 'True/False', or 'Yes/No' as defined by the [Salesforce Data Loader](https://help.salesforce.com) requirements.
Truncate text fields to stay within the character limits of the target database schema.
Increase the timeout settings on your load balancer or optimize the CSV processing logic to handle larger batches.
Add a descriptive first row to your CSV or specify 'no header' in your [Pandas read_csv](https://pandas.pydata.org) or import settings.

Error: Data type mismatch: expected Integer found String
ActionRecommended: Audit the specified column for non-numeric characters, spaces, or currency symbols that prevent mathematical parsing.

Error: Access Denied: S3 bucket policy restriction
ActionRecommended: Update the [AWS S3 Bucket Policy](https://aws.amazon.com) to allow the 'GetObject' or 'PutObject' action for your user.
Use a 'Trim' function or a [Python script](https://docs.python.org) to remove leading/trailing spaces that cause lookup failures.
Clear temporary system files or redirect the output stream to a volume with more available storage space.
Save the CSV as 'UTF-8 without BOM' to prevent mapping errors in systems like [Microsoft SQL Server](https://learn.microsoft.com).
Identify rows with empty fields and provide a default value or remove the row before importing into the [PostgreSQL database](https://www.postgresql.org).
Review parent-child relationships in your CSV to ensure no record references itself or creates an infinite loop.
Ensure your SSH key is added to the [GitHub Agent](https://docs.github.com) or server authorized_keys file.
Check the server-side logs for a stack trace; the issue is likely a crash in the [backend API](https://developer.mozilla.org) logic.
Remove symbols like #, $, or % from your CSV header row to comply with [BigQuery table naming](https://cloud.google.com) rules.

Error: Invalid URI: The format could not be determined
ActionRecommended: Check that URLs in your data columns are properly prefixed with http:// or https://.

Error: Locked record: record currently being edited
ActionRecommended: Retry the import after the target record is released by the current user or background process.
Verify that the database service is running and that the [firewall allows traffic](https://docs.aws.amazon.com) on that specific port.
Increase the system's ulimit or ensure your script explicitly closes file handles after processing each CSV.
Refresh your [OAuth 2.0 access token](https://auth0.com) or re-authenticate to obtain a new session.
Ensure your request includes a valid CSRF token in the headers to pass [OWASP security checks](https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org).

Error: Account locked due to multiple failed attempts
ActionRecommended: Wait for the lockout period to expire or reset your credentials via the [identity provider's portal](https://support.microsoft.com).
Renew the certificate for your domain using [Let's Encrypt](https://letsencrypt.org) or check your system clock settings.
Reduce the frequency of requests or request an [API quota increase](https://developers.google.com) from the provider.
Use a virtual environment or [Docker container](https://www.docker.com) to isolate specific library versions.
Verify the domain spelling or check if the record is correctly configured in your [Cloudflare DNS dashboard](https://dash.cloudflare.com).

Error: Resource limit hit: Out of Memory (OOM)
ActionRecommended: Optimize your script to use generators instead of loading the full CSV into a [Pandas DataFrame](https://pandas.pydata.org).
Ensure the remote socket is still open before sending data; check for network stability or server-side timeouts.

Error: File not found in expected directory

Manually resolve overlapping changes in [Git](https://docs.github.com) and commit the fixed version.
Run 'docker system prune' or expand the EBS volume via the [AWS Console](https://console.aws.amazon.com).

Update your [JSON Schema](https://json-schema.org) or CSV mapping to align with the latest API version definitions.
Update your integration to use the newer version specified in the [developer changelog](https://developer.mozilla.org).
Check the status of your [GitHub Actions](https://github.com) self-hosted runners or increase your concurrent job quota.

Error: Data loss: partial write to destination
ActionRecommended: Verify the [Snowflake COPY INTO](https://docs.snowflake.com) command options and check the 'ON_ERROR' parameter settings.

Error: Deadlock found when trying to get lock; try restarting transaction
